problem.markdown:
>>What is Creep?<< ( ) Time independent elastic deformation at constant temperature ( ) Time independent plastic deformation at constant temperature ( ) Time dependent elastic deformation at constant stress (X) Time dependent permanent deformation at a constant stress
>>Creep usually occurs at temperatures of:<< ( ) < 0.2 Tm (x) > 0.4 Tm ( ) at Tm ( ) > Tm (where Tm is the melting point of the material).
>>In the primary/transient stage, the creep rate:<< ( ) Remains zero ( ) Increases with time ( ) Remains constant (non zero) (x) Decreases with time
>>In the secondary /steady state, the creep rate:<< ( ) Remains zero ( ) Increases with time (x) Remains constant (non zero) ( ) Decreases with time
>>In the tertiary state, the creep rate:<< ( ) Remains zero (x) Rapidly increases with time ( ) Remains constant (non zero) ( ) Rapidly decreases with time
>>In which state a balance between recovery and strain hardening is achieved?<< ( ) During instantaneous strain ( ) Primary Creep (x) Secondary Creep ( ) Tertiary Creep
>>Which of the following DOES NOT affect creep rate:<< ( ) Equicohesive temperature (x) Density of material ( ) Applied Load/stress ( ) Exposure time
>>As the temperature increases, the creep rate:<< (x) Increases ( ) Does not change ( ) Decreases
>>As the obstacle distance increases, the creep rate:<< (x) Increases ( ) Does not change ( ) Decreases
>>Comparatively between two materials, as the steady state creep rate of material-1 is lower (at constant temperature) with respect to material-2, it means:<< (x) Working life of material-1 will be higher compared to material-2 ( ) Working life of the material-1 will be same as that of material-2 ( ) Working life of material-2 will be higher compared to material-1 ( ) Density of material-2 is higher than that of material-1

choicegroup.label: What is Creep?
choicegroup.choice: Time independent elastic deformation at constant temperature
Time independent plastic deformation at constant temperature
Time dependent elastic deformation at constant stress
Time dependent permanent deformation at a constant stress
